oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United Confederate Veterans badge of John Lafayette Morgan, Co. B, 29th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John L. Morgan was from Reliance in Polk County, Tennessee. During the war he served as the color bearer for the 29th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Federal soliders captured Morgan while he was on furlough in Murray County, Georgia in February 1864. He was held at Fort Delaware, Delaware until his exchange in February 1865. Morgan was active in the United Confederate Veterans after the war and received this souvenir medal for attending the 1908 reunion in Birmingham, Alabama.
